column4: Does windows have to be installed on the 1st primary partition?
no.  It just has to think it is.
is there a way to do that?
the problem I'm having is installing windows.  When i run the install CD, it claims there is no space avaliable
GRUB doesn't even run when the CD boots, right?
oh, thats different.  Do you have any space available?
yes, and it's at the front of the disk
but my current ubuntu install is /dev/sda1
once you create a new partition infront of sda1, it'll become sda2.
if i try with fdisk it claims its already taken
In the windows installer, you'll be able to create a partition.
hmm... I'll try, but I don't think it let me
It doesn't let me get to the partitioning system
is there a way I can change my ubuntu install from /dev/sda1 to something else?
or at least whichi primary partition it is
